channel.title: Just a tad stuck on compiling-ish
channel.description:
So yesterday I spent around 8 hours total trying to fix this, with no luck and a sore head I gave it one more try. After a little bit of head-scratching and trial and error I got it this morning at 7am, Me actually waking up at 7am is one thing, but never mind that, I got the compiler to actually compile.
But now when I run the client, it gives me this.
javac: invalid flag: -Xmx500m Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
It's probably something simple-ish. Any help is welcome (inb4we'renotaspoonfeedingcommunity) I'm old enough to learn :/ (more)
I wont reply after a bit, so I'll post the run client here and see if any of you can help me. :p
@echo off title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe" -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause
/E I don't have to run the server to play by myself right? ... lol
Someone help me :/

item.title: Just a tad stuck on compiling-ish
item.dc:creator: @Millionaires Millionaires
item.description:
@Millionaires wrote:

So yesterday I spent around 8 hours total trying to fix this, with no luck and a sore head I gave it one more try.
After a little bit of head-scratching and trial and error I got it this morning at 7am, Me actually waking up at 7am is one thing, but never mind that, I got the compiler to actually compile.

But now when I run the client, it gives me this.

javac: invalid flag: -Xmx500m
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . .

It’s probably something simple-ish.
Any help is welcome (inb4we’renotaspoonfeedingcommunity) I’m old enough to learn (more)

I wont reply after a bit, so I’ll post the run client here and see if any of you can help me.

@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

/E I don’t have to run the server to play by myself right? … lol

Someone help me

Read full topic
item.source: Just a tad stuck on compiling-ish
